intro: Atitara costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican atitara, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas within tropical forests. The leaves are usually heart-shaped and have a rough texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
